page.title: 06Religion in South Clifton
page.content: The Church of England is represented by the Parish Church of North Clifton St.George.It is situated near the school halfway between North and South Clifton.The vicar,Rev.M.W.Briggs has been incumbent since 1981.He is also in charge of Thorney,Harby and Broadholme.He takes three or four services each Sunday in the area.There is also a Methodist Church at South Clifton which is in the Lincoln North Circuit.The Methodist Minister lives at Saxilby.There is also a thriving Sunday School at the Methodist Church.Spalford has no religious building but comes wihin the Parish of South Scarle.Low Marnham has a church which is disused services being held in a small building nearby.In the church is a memorial to Edmund Cartwright,the inventor of the power loom who was born here.
